name: aback
trans: adv. 向后；处于顶风位置；向后地

name: abandonment
trans: n. 放弃；抛弃；遗弃；放任

sentences.english: ...memories of her father's complete abandonment of her.
sentences.chinese: …她父亲对她的彻底抛弃的那些记忆。

detailed_translations.english: The abandonment of a place, thing, or person is the act of leaving it permanently or for a long time, especially when you should not do so

name: absorption
trans: n. 吸收,；吸收过程；吸收作用; 专注，专心致志; 合并；同化; 营养物溶入血液或淋巴液 形容词: absorptive 名 词: absorptivity

sentences.english: This controls the absorption of liquids.
sentences.chinese: 这可以控制液体的吸收。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吸收；全神贯注，专心致志
detailed_translations.english: a process in which something takes in liquid, gas, or heat

name: accordance
trans: n. 一致, 和谐, 符合

sentences.english: I am in accordance with him in this matter.
sentences.chinese: 在这件事情上我同他是一致的。

sentences.english: We assure you that the quality of our goods will be in accordance with that of the samples.
sentences.chinese: 我们向你方保证，我们货物的质量一定与样品的质量一致。

sentences.english: If your pursuit of personal career and ideal are in accordance with ours, if you are seeking for the pleasure from sharing the same ambitions, please join us!
sentences.chinese: 如果您想谋求个人事业、理想与公司的事业和理想高度一致，如果您追求的是志同道合的工作愉悦，请加入我们！

name: accountant
trans: n. 会计人员, 会计师名 词: accountancy

sentences.english: The boss dropped an accountant from the payroll.
sentences.chinese: 老板把一名会计师从在职人员名单中除了名。

sentences.english: The accountant checked this unnecessary spending in good time.
sentences.chinese: 会计及时卡住了这笔不必要的开支。

sentences.english: They conferred with the accountant vis-à-vis the proposed budget.
sentences.chinese: 他们与会计商量有关预算提案的事。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to keep and check financial accounts, calculate taxes etc

name: accredited
trans: adj. 可接受的,可信任的,公认的,质量合格的

name: adjacent
trans: adj. 邻近的

sentences.chinese: 我们住在毗连的房间里。

sentences.english: the building adjacent to the library
sentences.chinese: 紧挨着图书馆的建筑

detailed_translations.english: (of an area, a building, a room, etc.) next to or near sth

trans: n. 附件,助手; adj. 附属的 名 词: adjunction 形容词: adjunctive

sentences.english: For me, it represents a potent adjunct to antidepressant medications and, for some patients, it’s something you can take in lieu of pills.
sentences.chinese: 对于我，它是一个抗抑郁剂曾用药物的强有力的助手，对一些病人来说，它是能够代替药丸的东西。

sentences.english: " Lyte urges caution as well."It MAY, in really big capitals, prove to be an adjunct to therapy, but there are a number of steps that need to be done.
sentences.chinese: 我们在花费了大量的人力物力之后，也许，也许证明它可以成为一种附属的治疗手段，但是我们仍然有大量的工作要做。

detailed_translations.english: something that is added or joined to something that is bigger or more important

name: affair
trans: n. 事情；事务；私事；风流韵事

sentences.english: Are you interested in world affairs?
sentences.chinese: 你对世界大事感兴趣吗？

sentences.english: the Ministry of Foreign Affairs
sentences.chinese: 外交部

sentences.english: Women had little role in public affairs.
sentences.chinese: 女性过去几乎不参与公共事务。

sentences.english: the Watergate affair
sentences.chinese: 水门事件

sentences.english: He had an affair with his boss that lasted six years.
sentences.chinese: 他和老板的暧昧关系持续了六年。

detailed_translations.english: public or political events and activities

name: aggregate
trans: n. 〈正〉数, 总计; vt. 总计达…; vt. & vi. 聚集 时 态: aggregated, aggregating, aggregates 副 词: aggr...

sentences.chinese: 希拉的所有收入总计为10万英镑。

detailed_translations.english: to be a particular amount when added together
the total after a lot of different figures or points have been added together
being the total amount of something after all the figures or points have been added together

name: alarming
trans: adj. 使人害怕的;扰乱人心的

name: albeit
trans: conj. 即使；虽然

sentences.english: He accepted the job, albeit with some hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 尽管有些犹豫，他还是接受了那份工作。

sentences.english: Chris went with her, albeit reluctantly.
sentences.chinese: 尽管勉强，克里斯还是同她一起去了。

detailed_translations.english: used to add information that reduces the force or importance of what you have just said

name: alphabetically
trans: adv. 照字母顺序排列地

sentences.english: For example, you could list your records in your report alphabetically.
sentences.chinese: 例如，可以在报告中按字母顺序列出记录。

sentences.english: Some options led to a second list of recipes organized alphabetically or by most recent entry.
sentences.chinese: 一些选项指向按字母顺序或者按最近访问组织的另一个菜谱列表。

sentences.english: You can sort the rows within a table of data according to the data type, allowing you to order by figures — alphabetically and by date.
sentences.chinese: 您还可以根据数据类型对数据表格中的行进行排序，这样便可以按数字、字母和日期进行排序。

name: amateur
trans: adj. 业余的, 非职业的; 外行的; n. 业余爱好者; 外行, 生手 名 词: amateurism

sentences.english: a gifted amateur
sentences.chinese: 有天赋的业余爱好者

sentences.english: Mickelson won his first major golf tournament while still an amateur.
sentences.chinese: 米克尔森还是业余选手时就赢得了他第一个高尔夫球锦标赛大奖。

sentences.english: ...professional athletes and amateur runners.
sentences.chinese: …专业运动员和业余赛跑运动员。

detailed_translations.chinese: 爱好者；业余爱好者；外行
detailed_translations.english: someone who does an activity just for pleasure, not as their job
Amateur sports or activities are done by people as a hobby and not as a job

name: ambiguous
trans: adj. 引起歧义的；模棱两可的，含糊不清的

sentences.english: The language in the Minister’s statement is highly ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 部长的声明措辞很含糊。

sentences.english: His role in the affair is ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 他在这起事件中的角色并不明确。

detailed_translations.english: that can be understood in more than one way; having different meanings

name: ambition
trans: n. 野心，雄心；抱负，志向; vt. 有…野心；追求

sentences.english: He was young and full of ambition.
sentences.chinese: 他年轻，而且雄心勃勃。

detailed_translations.english: determination to be successful, rich, powerful etc

name: amend
trans: vt. 改善，改进；修改; vi. 改正，改善；改过自新 时 态: amended, amending, amends

sentences.english: The law was amended to include women.
sentences.chinese: 该法律经修改把女性也包括在内。

sentences.english: The defendant later amended his evidence.
sentences.chinese: 被告后来修改了证词。

sentences.english: ‘Steve stole it – or rather borrowed it,’ he amended.
sentences.chinese: “史蒂夫偷的——应该说是借的。”他改口道。

detailed_translations.english: to correct or make small changes to something that is written or spoken

name: amused
trans: adj. 被逗笑的; 愉快的;顽皮的; 逗乐；让某人开心

name: analogy
trans: n. 类似, 相似; 类推, 类推法

sentences.english: analogies between human and animal behaviour
sentences.chinese: 人类行为与动物行为的类同

sentences.english: She drew an analogy between childbirth and the creative process.
sentences.chinese: 她将分娩和创造过程进行类比。

detailed_translations.english: something that seems similar between two situations, processes etc

name: anecdote
trans: n. 掌故, 趣闻, 轶事

sentences.english: The book is full of amusing anecdotes about his life in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 这本书里全是他在日本生活的趣闻轶事。

detailed_translations.english: a short story based on your personal experience

name: annoying
trans: adj. 讨厌的；恼人的，使人烦恼的副 词: annoyingly

sentences.english: an annoying habit of interrupting
sentences.chinese: 打断他人讲话的讨厌习惯

sentences.english: The annoying thing is he’s usually right.
sentences.chinese: 令人气恼的是，他通常都是对的。

sentences.english: It’s annoying that we didn’t know about this before.
sentences.chinese: 令人恼火的是，我们以前并不知道这事。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel slightly angry

trans: n. 解药,解毒剂; 对抗手段,矫正方法; 除害物 形容词: antidotal

sentences.english: When he returned, he noticed their sickness and prepared an antidote.
sentences.chinese: 当他返回时，他注意到了他们的病情，准备了解毒药。

detailed_translations.chinese: [药] 解毒剂；解药；矫正方法
detailed_translations.english: a substance that stops the effects of a poison

name: antique
trans: adj. 古时制造的, 古董的; 古代的; n. 古玩, 古董, 古物 时 态: antiqued, antiquing, antiques

sentences.english: an antique rosewood desk
sentences.chinese: 古董红木书桌

detailed_translations.chinese: 古老的，年代久远的；过时的，古董的；古风的，古式的
detailed_translations.english: antique furniture, jewellery etc is old and often valuable

detailed_translations.chinese: 古董，古玩；古风，古希腊和古罗马艺术风格
detailed_translations.english: a piece of furniture, jewellery etc that was made a very long time ago and is therefore valuable

trans: vt. & vi. 道歉

sentences.chinese: 奈杰尔收到信后，愿意向俱乐部道歉，并修正他的评论，但俱乐部拒绝了这个服软的表示。

sentences.english: But it has been on my mind for so long, and I apologise if it is irrelevant to some readers.
sentences.chinese: 但是它占据我的内心很久了。 如果它与一些读者没有关系，我向你们道歉。

name: appeasement
trans: n. 平息;缓和;满足;姑息; 姑息政策;绥靖主义

name: appointment
trans: n. 约会, 约定; 任命, 委派

sentences.chinese: 就诊必须预约。

sentences.english: Other changes included the appointment of a new Foreign Minister.
sentences.chinese: 其他变动包括任命了一位新的外交部长。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement for a meeting at an agreed time and place, for a particular purpose

name: aptitude
trans: n. 天资；天生的才能；天赋

sentences.chinese: 他偶入出版界，发现自己具有管账的天资。

detailed_translations.english: natural ability or skill, especially in learning

name: archive
trans: v. 存档; n. 档案文件 动 词: archive

sentences.english: an archive of the writer’s unpublished work
sentences.chinese: 那位作家未发表作品的档案

detailed_translations.english: a place where a large number of historical records are stored, or the records that are stored
to put documents, books, information etc in an archive

name: ascent
trans: n. 上升；登高；上坡路 ASCENTabbr. Assembly System for Central Processor 中央处理器汇编系统

sentences.english: the first ascent of Qomolangma
sentences.chinese: 首次攀登珠穆朗玛峰

detailed_translations.english: the act of climbing something or moving upwards

name: assembly
trans: n. 装配；集会，集合

sentences.chinese: 警方给公共集会设置了条件。

sentences.english: Restrictions on freedom of assembly have gradually been relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 对集会自由的限制渐渐放宽了。

sentences.english: an assembly point
sentences.chinese: 集合地点

sentences.english: instructions for assembly
sentences.chinese: 装配说明（书）

detailed_translations.english: the meeting together of a group of people for a particular purpose

name: astronaut
trans: n. 宇航员, 太空人

sentences.english: So why become an astronaut at all?
sentences.chinese: 那么，为什么要成为一名宇航员呢？

sentences.english: Yes, I have wanted to be an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我想过成为一个宇航员。

sentences.english: Many different qualities go towards the making of an astronaut.
sentences.chinese: 一名宇航员必须具备许多不同的素质。

name: attachment

sentences.english: a child’s attachment to its mother
sentences.chinese: 孩子对母亲的依恋

sentences.chinese: 这台真空吸尘器有各种附件。

sentences.english: the attachments that secure your boots firmly to the skis
sentences.chinese: 把靴子牢牢固定在滑雪板上的扣件

name: awesome
trans: adj. 令人敬畏的；令人惊叹的；令人惊惧的; 很好的；了不起的

sentences.english: an awesome responsibility
sentences.chinese: 一项令人惊惧的责任

sentences.english: the awesome sweep of the scenery
sentences.chinese: 连绵的壮丽景色

detailed_translations.english: extremely impressive, serious, or difficult so that you feel great respect, worry, or fear

name: awful
trans: a.可怕的，庄严的 副 词: awfully 名 词: awfulness

sentences.english: The weather was awful.
sentences.chinese: 天气很糟糕。

detailed_translations.english: very bad or unpleasant

name: backdrop
trans: n. 背景幕布; 背景

sentences.english: ...the rugged cliffs that formed a backdrop to the village.
sentences.chinese: ...构成村庄天然屏障的崎岖峭壁。

detailed_translations.english: the  scenery  behind something that you are looking at

name: bargain
trans: n. 交易；契约；特价商品; vi. 讨价还价；成交; vt. 讨价还价；拿…做交易 时 态: bargained, bargaining, bargains 名 词: ...

sentences.english: I’ve kept my side of the bargain and I expect you to keep yours.
sentences.chinese: 我履行了我的承诺，希望你也履行你的承诺。

sentences.english: women bargaining with traders
sentences.chinese: 和商贩讨价还价的女人

name: barrage
trans: n. 火力网；弹幕; 弹幕射击；阻拦射击; 河上的堰坝; 猛烈炮火,枪林弹雨; vi. 火力攻击; vt. 以密集火力攻击 时 态: barraged, barraging, barr...

sentences.english: ...a hydro-electric tidal barrage.
sentences.chinese: …一座水力发电潮汐拦河坝。

detailed_translations.chinese: 弹幕；阻塞；齐射式攻击；[水利] 拦河坝
detailed_translations.english: the continuous firing of guns, dropping of bombs etc, especially to protect soldiers as they move towards an enemy

name: barrier
trans: n. 障碍物，屏障；界线; vt. 把…关入栅栏

sentences.chinese: 他提倡消除贸易壁垒。

sentences.english: Crowds burst through the barriers and ran onto the pitch.
sentences.chinese: 人群冲破围栏跑进球场。

sentences.english: The mountains form a natural barrier between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 群山构成了两国之间的天然屏障。

detailed_translations.english: a rule, problem etc that prevents people from doing something, or limits what they can do

name: bead
trans: n. 珠子；念珠；滴; vi. 形成珠状，起泡; vt. 用珠装饰；使成串珠状 时 态: beaded, beading, beads

sentences.english: She wore a string of green glass beads around her neck.
sentences.chinese: 她脖子上戴着一串绿色的玻璃珠子。

detailed_translations.english: one of a set of small, usually round, pieces of glass, wood, plastic etc, that you can put on a string and wear as jewellery

name: belt
trans: n. 腰带, 带子; 区域, 地带; vt.系住；抽打；击打; vi.疾驰；飞奔 时 态: belted, belting, belts

sentences.english: He unbuckled his leather belt.
sentences.chinese: 他解开皮带。

detailed_translations.english: a band of leather, cloth etc that you wear around your waist to hold up your clothes or for decoration

detailed_translations.chinese: 用带子系住；用皮带抽打
detailed_translations.english: to fasten something with a belt

name: beneficiary
trans: n. 受益者；受惠者; 受俸牧师，受俸神职人员; adj. 受圣俸的; 拥有封地的 形容词: beneficiary

sentences.english: One of the main beneficiaries of the early election is thought to be the former president.
sentences.chinese: 前总统被认为是早期选举的主要受益者之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: [金融] 受益人，受惠者；封臣
detailed_translations.english: someone who gets advantages from an action or change

name: betray
trans: vt. 背叛；出卖；泄露；露出…迹象 时 态: betrayed, betraying, betrays 名 词: betrayal 名 词: betrayer

sentences.english: He felt that she had betrayed him.
sentences.chinese: 他感觉她背叛了自己。

sentences.english: She had betrayed her parents' trust .
sentences.chinese: 她辜负了父母对她的信任。

sentences.english: I would never betray a confidence (=  tell a secret that someone has trusted me with  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会泄露秘密。

detailed_translations.chinese: 背叛， 出卖； 失信于， 辜负； 泄露； 暴露， 显露
detailed_translations.english: to be disloyal to someone who trusts you, so that they are harmed or upset

name: biased
trans: adj. 有偏见的;倾向性的;片面的; 偏重;偏向

sentences.english: Of course I’m biased, but I thought my daughter’s paintings were the best.
sentences.chinese: 当然我有偏心，但我还是认为我女儿的画最好。

sentences.english: racially biased attitudes
sentences.chinese: 带种族偏见的态度

detailed_translations.chinese: 有偏见的；结果偏倚的，有偏的
detailed_translations.english: unfairly preferring one person or group over another

name: biographer
trans: n. 传记作者

sentences.english: ...Picasso's biographer.
sentences.chinese: …毕加索的传记作者。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes a biography of someone else

name: bizarre
trans: adj. 奇异的 名 词: bizarreness

sentences.english: a bizarre coincidence
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的巧合

sentences.english: dancers in rather bizarre costumes
sentences.chinese: 身着奇装异服的舞者

detailed_translations.english: very unusual or strange

name: blaze
trans: n. 火焰, 烈火; 光辉, 闪耀; 迸发, 爆发; vi. 猛烈地燃烧; 发光, 照耀 时 态: blazed, blazing, blazes

sentences.english: Some 4,000 firefighters are battling the blaze.
sentences.chinese: 约有四千名消防人员正在与大火搏斗。

sentences.english: the blaze of light from the security lamps
sentences.chinese: 安全灯的强光

sentences.english: The room was warm, with a fire blazing in the hearth.
sentences.chinese: 房间里暖融融的，壁炉里的火熊熊燃烧。

detailed_translations.english: a big dangerous fire – used especially in news reports
to burn very brightly and strongly

name: blossom
trans: vi. 开花；兴旺；发展成; n. 花；开花期；兴旺期；花开的状态 时 态: blossomed, blossoming, blossoms 形容词: blossomy

sentences.english: pale pink blossoms
sentences.chinese: 淡粉色的花朵

sentences.english: The cherry tree was covered in blossom.
sentences.chinese: 樱桃树花满枝头。

detailed_translations.english: a flower or the flowers on a tree or bush

name: bold
trans: adj. 勇敢的, 无畏的; 冒失的, 鲁莽的; 明显的, 醒目的; 粗体的, 黑体的 比较级: bolder, boldest 副 词: boldly 名 词: b...

sentences.english: In a surprisingly bold move , he is threatening court action against the company.
sentences.chinese: 他出人意料地做出一个大胆举动，威胁要起诉这家公司。

sentences.english: My aunt Flo was a bold determined woman.
sentences.chinese: 我姑妈芙洛是一个大胆果断的人。

sentences.english: He had the ability to take bold imaginative decisions.
sentences.chinese: 他能够作出富有创见的大胆决定。

sentences.english: She marched into his office as bold as brass (= very confident and not showing enough respect ).
sentences.chinese: 她放肆地直闯进他的办公室。

detailed_translations.english: not afraid of taking risks and making difficult decisions

name: bonding
trans: n. 粘合；压焊; adj. 结合的；黏结的; v. 联系；结合

name: bracelet
trans: n. 手镯

sentences.english: a gold bracelet
sentences.chinese: 一只金手镯

detailed_translations.english: a band or chain that you wear around your wrist or arm as a decoration

name: brew

sentences.english: a space capsule orbiting the Earth
sentences.chinese: 沿地球轨道飞行的太空舱

sentences.chinese: 我不认识他，他不是平时那一群人里的。

sentences.chinese: 这家银行能为你提供外币。

sentences.chinese: 当地的货币是瑞士法郎。

sentences.chinese: 在正教会流行的欧洲地区，集体宗教信仰的影响力似乎衰退得没那么严重。

name: decompose
trans: vt. & vi. 变坏, 腐烂; vt. 分解 时 态: decomposed, decomposing, decomposes 名 词: decomposability ...

sentences.english: a partially decomposed body
sentences.chinese: 部分腐烂的尸体

detailed_translations.english: to decay or make something decay

name: dedicated
trans: adj. 专注的;献身的; 专用的

sentences.english: a dedicated graphics processor
sentences.chinese: 专用图形处理器

name: deficiency
trans: n. 缺乏, 不足, 短缺

sentences.chinese: 他们给他做了血检看是否有缺乏维生素的迹象。

sentences.english: There are deep deficiencies in this law.

trans: n. 不足额; 赤字, 亏空, 亏损

sentences.chinese: 这个国家日益严重的预算赤字

name: delete

sentences.english: What have I done to deserve this?
sentences.chinese: 我做了什么事，要得到这样的报应？

sentences.english: I’m sorry for the kids. They deserve better (= deserve to be treated in a better way ) .
sentences.chinese: 我为这些孩子感到难过，他们应该过得更好。

sentences.english: Ledley deserves a place in the team.
sentences.chinese: 莱德利应该在队里占有一席之地。

sentences.english: Paula deserves a special mention for all the help she has given us.
sentences.chinese: 应该特别提一下葆拉，她给了我们许多帮助。

sentences.english: I would never hit anyone, even if they deserved it.
sentences.chinese: 我决不会打人，哪怕他欠揍。

sentences.english: What has he done to deserve this punishment ?
sentences.chinese: 他做了什么，竟会受到这样的惩罚？

sentences.english: People who are sent to prison for drunk-driving get what they deserve .
sentences.chinese: 那些醉酒驾车被送进监狱的人是罪有应得的。

detailed_translations.english: to have earned something by good or bad actions or behaviour

name: dessert
trans: n. 餐后甜点；甜点心

sentences.english: She had homemade ice cream for dessert.
sentences.chinese: 她吃了些自制冰淇淋当餐后甜点。

detailed_translations.english: sweet food served after the main part of a meal

name: deter
trans: vt. 制止，阻止；使打消念头 时 态: deterred, deterring, deters 名 词: determent 形容词: deterrable

sentences.english: The company’s financial difficulties have deterred potential investors.
sentences.chinese: 该公司的财务困境令潜在的投资者望而却步。

detailed_translations.english: to stop someone from doing something, by making them realize it will be difficult or have bad results

name: devoid
trans: adj. 缺乏的；全无的

sentences.english: We humans appear to be meaning-seeking creatures that have the misfortune to be thrown into a world devoid of intrinsic meaning.
sentences.chinese: 我们人类似乎是寻求意义的生物，而很不幸，我们却进入了一个本质上缺乏意义的世界。

sentences.english: Rice cakes may seem like a good option – after all they're fat-free and low in calories – but they're also devoid of fibre and protein and can make you crave something more satisfying.
sentences.chinese: 大米蛋糕似乎是好的选择-毕竟它们无脂肪，低卡路里-但是它们也缺乏纤维和蛋白质，会使你渴望更令人满意的东西。

name: diagnosis
trans: n. 〈医〉诊断法; 诊断结论

sentences.english: An exact diagnosis can only be made by obtaining a blood sample.
sentences.chinese: 只有抽取血样才能作出准确的诊断。

detailed_translations.english: the process of discovering exactly what is wrong with someone or something, by examining them closely

name: dictate
trans: vt. & vi. 大声讲或读；口授; vt. 指示；指定；指令; n. 命令，规定，要求 时 态: dictated，dictating，dictates

sentences.english: Federal funds have to be used as dictated by Washington.
sentences.chinese: 联邦款项得按照华盛顿规定的途径使用。

sentences.english: The US government attempted to dictate the terms of the agreement.
sentences.chinese: 美国政府企图规定协议的条款。

sentences.english: teenagers following the dictates of fashion
sentences.chinese: 赶时髦的青少年

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone exactly what they must do or how they must behave
an order, rule, or principle that you have to obey

name: disapprove
trans: vi. 不赞成时 态: disapproved, disapproving, disapproves 副 词: disapprovingly

sentences.english: I knew my parents would disapprove, but I went anyway.
sentences.chinese: 我知道父母会反对，但我还是去了。

sentences.english: Her family strongly disapproved of her behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 她的家人极不赞同她的行为。

detailed_translations.english: to think that someone or their behaviour, ideas etc are bad or wrong

name: discerning
trans: adj. 有识别力的;有眼力的;有洞察力的

sentences.english: an ideal tour for the discerning traveller
sentences.chinese: 对具鉴赏品位的游客而言一次理想之旅

detailed_translations.chinese: 有辨识能力的；眼光敏锐的
detailed_translations.english: showing the ability to make good judgments, especially about art, music, style etc

name: disclose
trans: vt. 揭露；公开 时 态: disclosed, disclosing, discloses

sentences.english: Some companies have already voluntarily disclosed similar information .
sentences.chinese: 一些公司已经主动透露了类似的信息。

sentences.english: He refused to disclose the identity of the politician.
sentences.chinese: 他拒绝透露那位政治家的身份。

detailed_translations.english: to make something publicly known, especially after it has been kept secret

name: disorderly
trans: adj. 杂乱的，凌乱的; 妨碍治安的，制造混乱的；无法无天的; n. 混乱，杂乱 名 词: disorderliness

sentences.english: clothes left in a disorderly heap
sentences.chinese: 乱七八糟堆在一起的衣服

detailed_translations.english: untidy or without any order

name: dispersal
trans: n. 散布,分散,消散,驱散,疏散

sentences.english: the role of birds in the dispersal of seeds
sentences.chinese: 鸟类对传播种子的作用

detailed_translations.english: the process of spreading things over a wide area or in different directions

name: disposable
trans: adj. 一次使用后即丢掉的, 一次性的; 可自由支配的

sentences.english: disposable resources
sentences.chinese: 可支配的资源

sentences.english: Currently, disposables account for about 80% to 85% of the $3 billion-plus annual diaper market.
sentences.chinese: 目前，一次性尿布占年销售额30多亿美元的尿布市场的80%至85%左右。

detailed_translations.english: available to be used

detailed_translations.chinese: 一次性物品， 不回收物品
detailed_translations.english: Disposable products can be referred to as disposables

name: dispute
trans: vt. 辩论；阻止；抗拒；怀疑; vi. 争论; n. 辩论；争吵 时 态: disputed, disputing, disputes 名 词: disputer

sentences.english: It is beyond dispute that advances in medicine have enabled people to live longer.
sentences.chinese: 医学的发展使人们更加长寿，这是无可置疑的。

sentences.english: What happened next is hotly disputed .
sentences.chinese: 关于后来发生了什么，争论很激烈。

detailed_translations.english: a serious argument or disagreement
to argue or disagree with someone

name: disrespectful
trans: adj. 失礼的,无礼的

sentences.english: ...accusations that he had been disrespectful to a police officer.
sentences.chinese: ...关于他曾对一名警官无礼的控告。

detailed_translations.english: If you are disrespectful, you show no respect in the way that you speak or behave to someone

name: disseminate
trans: vt. 散布, 传播时 态: disseminated, disseminating, disseminates 名 词: dissemination 名 词: dis...

sentences.english: Her findings have been widely disseminated .
sentences.chinese: 她的发现已广为传播。

detailed_translations.english: to spread information or ideas to as many people as possible

name: distorted
trans: adj. 扭歪的,受到曲解的

name: disturbance
trans: n. 打扰, 扰乱; 骚乱, 纷乱; 困扰

sentences.english: There were disturbances in the crowd as fans left the stadium.
sentences.chinese: 球迷离开体育场时，人群中发生了骚乱。

sentences.english: When a helicopter lands, it can cause a disturbance to local residents.
sentences.chinese: 直升机降落会惊扰当地居民。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which people behave violently in public

name: domesticated
trans: adj. 喜欢家庭生活的; 被驯养了的

sentences.english: Ray’s very domesticated and even likes baking cakes.
sentences.chinese: 雷很喜欢做家务，他甚至爱烤蛋糕。

detailed_translations.english: domesticated animals are able to work for people or live with them as pets

name: doomsday
trans: n. 世界末日；最后的审判日 Doomsdayn. 最后审判日，世界末日

sentences.english: “This is what policy makers want to hear, ” he said. ”If you focus on doomsday statements, you will lose them.
sentences.chinese: “这才是政策制定者想听的”他说，“如果你把焦点放在描述世界末日上，你就会失去他们。

sentences.english: Does all of this add up to a doomsday scenario, with the threat having shifted from a US slowdown to food inflation?
sentences.chinese: 是否所有这一切都添加到世界末日的情况，在这个征兆下，转向从美国放缓的食物通货膨胀？

detailed_translations.chinese: 世界末日；最后的审判日
detailed_translations.english: In the Christian religion, Doomsday is the last day of the world, on which God will judge everyone

name: dripping
trans: n. 滴,滴下,滴下物,油滴

sentences.english: Sweat was dripping from her neck.
sentences.chinese: 汗水从她脖子上滴下来。

sentences.english: Sweat was dripping from his face.
sentences.chinese: 汗水从他脸上滴下来。

sentences.english: The rain was dripping down his neck.
sentences.chinese: 雨水沿着他的脖子往下滴。

detailed_translations.english: the oily substance that comes out of meat when you cook it
extremely wet

name: dub
trans: vt. 配音；授予称号；轻点；打击; n. 笨蛋；鼓声 时 态: dubbed, dubbing, dubs 名 词: dubber

sentences.english: It was dubbed into Spanish for Mexican audiences.
sentences.chinese: 它已为墨西哥观众配成西班牙语了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 配音；轻点；打击；授予称号
detailed_translations.english: to change the original spoken language of a film or television programme into another language

name: durable
trans: adj. 耐用的，持久的; n. 耐用品 副 词: durably

sentences.english: Wood is a durable material.
sentences.chinese: 木头是耐用材料。

detailed_translations.english: staying in good condition for a long time, even if used a lot

name: edible
trans: adj. 可食用的; n. 食物；食品

sentences.english: These berries are edible, but those are poisonous.
sentences.chinese: 这些浆果可以吃，但那些有毒。

detailed_translations.chinese: 可以吃的， 可食用的
detailed_translations.english: something that is edible can be eaten

name: edition
trans: n. 版次, 版本

sentences.english: a paperback edition
sentences.chinese: 平装本

sentences.english: the US edition of Marie Claire magazine
sentences.chinese: 《嘉人》杂志的美国版

sentences.english: Martin was reading the early edition of the Evening News.
sentences.chinese: 马丁在看《新闻晚报》的早间版

sentences.english: The textbook was first published in 1858 and is now in its 39th edition.
sentences.chinese: 该课本初版于1858年，现在已经是第39版了。

detailed_translations.english: the form that a book, newspaper, magazine etc is produced in

name: elastic
trans: adj. 有弹性的；易伸缩的；灵活的; n. 松紧带；橡皮圈 副 词: elastically

sentences.english: a piece of elastic
sentences.chinese: 一根橡皮带

sentences.english: the horny elastic pad in a horse’s hoof
sentences.chinese: 马蹄上粗硬而有弹性的肉掌

detailed_translations.english: a type of rubber material that can stretch and then return to its usual length or size
a material that is elastic can stretch and then go back to its usual length or size

name: elevated
trans: adj. 升高的，提高的；高的；高层的; 高尚的，崇高的; 振奋的，欢欣的; n. 高架铁路

sentences.english: elevated philosophical language
sentences.chinese: 充满智慧的哲学语言

detailed_translations.chinese: 提高的；高尚的；严肃的；欢欣的
detailed_translations.english: elevated thoughts, words etc seem to be intelligent or of high moral standard

detailed_translations.chinese: 提高；抬起；振奋；提拔（elevate的过去分词）

name: embed
trans: vt. 栽种；使嵌入，使插入；使深留脑中 时 态: embedded, embedding, embeds 名 词: embedment

sentences.english: Feelings of guilt are deeply embedded in her personality.
sentences.chinese: 负罪感在她的性格里根深蒂固。

detailed_translations.chinese: 把…嵌入， 扎牢； 使深留脑中
detailed_translations.english: to put something firmly and deeply into something else, or to be put into something in this way

name: embrace
trans: vt. & vi. 拥抱; vt. 包括；包含; 接受; 信奉，皈依; n. 拥抱，怀抱 时 态: embraced，embracing，embraces 形容词: embr...

sentences.english: We hope these regions will embrace democratic reforms.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望这些地区会乐意接受民主改革。

sentences.english: Most West European countries have embraced the concept of high-speed rail networks with enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 大多数西欧国家都表现出极大的兴趣，欣然接受修建高速铁路网的想法。

detailed_translations.english: to eagerly accept a new idea, opinion, religion etc

name: emulate
trans: vt. 与…竞争, 努力赶上时 态: emulated, emulating, emulates 形容词: emulative 副 词: emulatively 名...

sentences.english: He hoped to emulate the success of Wilder.
sentences.chinese: 他希望效仿怀尔德的成功。

detailed_translations.chinese: 仿真；模仿；尽力赶上；同…竞争
detailed_translations.english: to do something or behave in the same way as someone else, especially because you admire them

name: encase
trans: vt. 把…放入盒内；把…装箱时 态: encased，encasing，encases 名 词: encasement

sentences.english: When nuclear fuel is manufactured it is encased in metal cans.
sentences.chinese: 核燃料生产出来时被装在金属罐中。

detailed_translations.english: to cover or surround something completely

name: encompass
trans: vt. 围绕；包围时 态: encompassed，encompassing，encompasses

sentences.english: The study encompasses the social, political, and economic aspects of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 这项研究涵盖了这一局势的社会、政治和经济三方面。

detailed_translations.english: to include a wide range of ideas, subjects, etc

name: endeavour
trans: n. 〈英〉尽力,竭力

sentences.english: But I will endeavour to banish every painful thought, and think only of what will make me happy: your affection, and the invariable kindness of my dear uncle and aunt.
sentences.chinese: 可是我一定会竭力打消一切苦痛的念头，只去想一些能使我高兴的事───譬如想想你的亲切以及亲爱的舅父母对我始终如一的关切。

detailed_translations.chinese: 竭力做到，试图或力图（做某事）
detailed_translations.english: to try very hard

name: enforcement
trans: n. 强制,实施,执行

name: engross
trans: vt. 使全神贯注；用大字体书写；正式写成；独占；吸引 时 态: engrossed, engrossing, engrosses

sentences.english: The scene was stunning, and for a time engrossed all our attention.
sentences.chinese: 景色非常美丽，一时间把我们都完全吸引住了。

detailed_translations.english: if something engrosses you, it interests you so much that you do not notice anything else

name: enlarge
trans: vi. 扩大；放大；详述; vt. 使增大；扩大；扩展 时 态: enlarged, enlarging, enlarges 名 词: enlarger

sentences.english: There are plans to enlarge the recreation area.
sentences.chinese: 已经有了扩大娱乐场地的计划。

sentences.english: Police will have the pictures enlarged in an attempt to identify the thief.
sentences.chinese: 为了确认窃贼的身份，警方会将这些照片放大。

detailed_translations.english: to make sth bigger; to become bigger

name: envisage
trans: vt. 正视，面对；想像 时 态: envisaged, envisaging, envisages

sentences.english: The scheme cost a lot more than we had originally envisaged.
sentences.chinese: 该计划的花费大大超出了我们最初所预想的数额。

detailed_translations.english: to think that something is likely to happen in the future

name: epic
trans: adj. 史诗的，叙事诗的; n. 史诗；叙事诗；史诗般的作品 EPICabbr. Earth-Pointing Instrument Carrier 指向地球的仪器运载卫星

sentences.english: an epic tale of mutiny on the high seas
sentences.chinese: 关于公海哗变的惊心动魄的故事

sentences.english: epic poetry
sentences.chinese: 史诗

detailed_translations.english: an epic book, poem, or film tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

detailed_translations.chinese: 史诗；叙事诗；史诗般的作品
detailed_translations.english: a book, poem, or film that tells a long story about brave actions and exciting events

name: equity
trans: n. 公平，公正；普通股；衡平法；抵押资产的净值

sentences.english: a society run on the principles of equity and justice
sentences.chinese: 以公平、正义为原则的社会

detailed_translations.chinese: 公平，公正；衡平法；普通股；抵押资产的净值
detailed_translations.english: a situation in which all people are treated equally and no one has an unfair advantage

name: era
trans: n. 时代；年代；纪元 ERAabbr. Electrical Research Association 电气研究协会 ERAabbr. Electrical Research As...

sentences.english: His death marked the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: 他的去世标志着一个时代的终结。

sentences.english: the Victorian era
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代

detailed_translations.english: a period of time in history that is known for a particular event, or for particular qualities

name: esteem
trans: vt. 认为；尊敬；考虑；估价; n. 尊重；尊敬 时 态: esteemed, esteeming, esteems

sentences.english: Peden was greatly esteemed by the people of Ayrshire.
sentences.chinese: 佩登深受艾尔郡人的尊敬。

sentences.english: He was esteemed as a literary wit.
sentences.chinese: 他被尊为文学才子。

detailed_translations.english: to respect and admire someone or something

name: ethical
trans: adj. 道德的；伦理的；凭处方出售的; n. 处方药 副 词: ethically

sentences.english: The president must have the highest ethical standards.
sentences.chinese: 总统必须具备最高的道德水准。

detailed_translations.chinese: 伦理的；道德的；凭处方出售的
detailed_translations.english: relating to principles of what is right and wrong

name: ethnographer
trans: n. 民族志学者,人种学者

name: evoke
trans: vt. 产生, 引起, 唤起时 态: evoked, evoking, evokes 形容词: evocable

sentences.english: The photographs evoked strong memories of our holidays in France.
sentences.chinese: 那些照片勾起了我们到法国度假的深刻回忆。

sentences.english: His appearance is bound to evoke sympathy.
sentences.chinese: 他的外表肯定会引起人们的同情。

sentences.english: Her speech evoked a hostile response.
sentences.chinese: 她的讲话引起了敌对的反应。

detailed_translations.chinese: 唤起， 引起， 使人想起
detailed_translations.english: to produce a strong feeling or memory in someone

name: exempt
trans: vt. 免除；豁免; adj. 被免除的；被豁免的; n. 免税者；被免除义务者 时 态: exempted, exempting, exempts 形容词: exemp...

sentences.english: So we have the current argument over how much of the derivative market will be exempt from regulation.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们就看到了当前有关衍生产品市场到底有多大份额可以得到规则的豁免的辩论。

sentences.english: All the new rules do is exempt the user from legal liability - something Apple does not appear to be pursuing anyway.
sentences.chinese: 新法规做到的仅仅是免除了用户的法律责任 - 看起来苹果本来也不打算追究这种责任。

sentences.english: So empirical approaches to literature, the simple observation of data from which one can generalize -they exempt these from the general charge against literary theory.
sentences.chinese: 文学的经验主义研究方法，对我们所概括的事物的简单数据观察,对文学理论的普遍控诉中,他们免除了这些。

name: exhale
trans: vt. & vi. 呼出；发散出时 态: exhaled，exhaling，exhales

sentences.english: Take a deep breath, then exhale slowly.
sentences.chinese: 深吸一口气，然后慢慢呼出。

detailed_translations.english: to breathe air, smoke etc out of your mouth

name: fake
trans: vt. 伪造, 篡改, 对…做手脚; 仿造; vt. & vi. 假装; n. 骗子; 赝品; adj. 假的, 冒充的 时 态: faked, faking, fakes

sentences.english: fake fur
sentences.chinese: 人造毛皮

sentences.english: a fake ID card
sentences.chinese: 假身份证

sentences.english: a fake 20 dollar bill
sentences.chinese: 一张20美元的伪钞

detailed_translations.english: made to look like a real material or object in order to deceive people
a copy of a valuable object, painting etc that is intended to deceive people

detailed_translations.chinese: 伪造， 捏造； 伪装
detailed_translations.english: to make something seem real in order to deceive people

name: fame
trans: n. 名声，名望；传闻，传说; vt. 使闻名，使有名望 时 态: famed, faming, fames

sentences.english: He claims he is not really interested in fame.
sentences.chinese: 他称自己对出名真的没有兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: the state of being known about by a lot of people because of your achievements

name: feeble
trans: adj. 虚弱的, 衰弱的, 无力的比较级: feebler, feeblest 名 词: feebleness 副 词: feebly

sentences.english: His voice sounded feeble and far away.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音听上去既无力又遥远。

sentences.english: She was too feeble to leave her room.
sentences.chinese: 她身体虚弱，无法走出自己的房间。

detailed_translations.chinese: 虚弱的， 衰弱的， 无力的； 无效的， 无益的
detailed_translations.english: extremely weak

name: fellow
trans: n. 男子；小伙子，家伙; 研究员，会员; 同伴，同志

sentences.english: Paul’s an easy-going sort of fellow.
sentences.chinese: 保罗人很随和。

detailed_translations.english: a man

name: flee
trans: vi. 逃走, 逃掉; vt. 逃离, 逃避 时 态: fled fleeing, flees 名 词: fleer

sentences.english: His attackers turned and fled.
sentences.chinese: 袭击他的人转身逃走了。

sentences.english: Masaari spent six months in prison before fleeing the country .
sentences.chinese: 正有蹲了六个月监狱，然后逃出了该国。

detailed_translations.english: to leave somewhere very quickly, in order to escape from danger

name: fluctuate
trans: vi. 波动, 涨落, 起伏时 态: fluctuated, fluctuating, fluctuates 形容词: fluctuant 名 词: fluctuati...

sentences.english: Insect populations fluctuate wildly from year to year.
sentences.chinese: 昆虫的数量每年变化很大。

sentences.english: Prices were volatile, fluctuating between 20 and 40.
sentences.chinese: 价格不稳定，在20至40美元之间波动。

detailed_translations.english: to change frequently in size, amount, quality, etc., especially from one extreme to another

name: flush
trans: v. 脸红，发红; 冲; 冲洗净，冲洗; 冲走; n. 潮红，脸红; 一阵强烈情感，一阵激情; 冲; 同花的一手牌; adj. 富有，很有钱; 完全齐平 时 态: flushed，fl...

sentences.english: Susan flushed deeply and looked away.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊脸涨得通红，目光转向别处。

sentences.english: He flushed angrily .
sentences.chinese: 他气得满脸通红。

detailed_translations.english: to become red in the face, for example when you are angry or embarrassed
if two surfaces are flush, they are at exactly the same level, so that the place where they meet is flat

name: forestry
trans: n. 林学；林业；森林地

sentences.english: ...his great interest in forestry.
sentences.chinese: …他对林业学的浓厚兴趣。

detailed_translations.english: the science or skill of looking after large areas of trees

name: fortnight
trans: n. 两星期, 十四天

sentences.english: a fortnight’s holiday
sentences.chinese: 十四天的假期

sentences.english: in a fortnight’s time
sentences.chinese: 两周后

sentences.english: a fortnight ago
sentences.chinese: 两周前

detailed_translations.english: two weeks

name: forum
trans: n. 论坛，讨论会；法庭；公开讨论的广场

sentences.english: the new national forum on the environment
sentences.chinese: 新的全国性环境论坛

detailed_translations.english: an organization, meeting, TV programme etc where people have a chance to publicly discuss an important subject

name: fracture
trans: n. 破裂，断裂；骨折; vi. 破裂；折断; vt. 使破裂 时 态: fractured, fracturing, fractures

sentences.english: a stress fracture in his left knee
sentences.chinese: 他左膝上的应力性骨折

sentences.english: a hairline fracture
sentences.chinese: 细小的裂缝

sentences.english: The immense pressure causes the rock to fracture.
sentences.chinese: 巨大的压力造成岩石断裂。

detailed_translations.english: a crack or broken part in a bone or other hard substance
if a bone or other hard substance fractures, or if it is fractured, it breaks or cracks

name: frustrating
trans: adj. 产生挫折的；使人沮丧的，令人泄气的

sentences.english: My job can be very frustrating sometimes.
sentences.chinese: 有时候我的工作令人很沮丧。

sentences.english: This is an immensely frustrating experience for the student.
sentences.chinese: 对于学生来说，这是非常令人沮丧的经历。

detailed_translations.english: making you feel annoyed, upset, or impatient because you cannot do what you want to do

name: fuzzy
trans: adj. 模糊的；有绒毛的；失真的 比较级: fuzzier, fuzziest 名 词: fuzziness

sentences.english: Some of the photos were so fuzzy it was hard to tell who was who.
sentences.chinese: 有些照片模糊不清，看不出谁是谁。

detailed_translations.chinese: 模糊的；失真的；有绒毛的
detailed_translations.english: if a sound or picture is fuzzy, it is unclear

name: gallop
trans: n. 疾驰；飞奔; vi. 急速进行；飞驰；急急忙忙地说; vt. 使飞跑；迅速运输 时 态: galloped, galloping, gallops 名 词: gal...

sentences.english: I was forced to attempt a gallop.
sentences.chinese: 我被迫尝试一次骑马疾驰。

detailed_translations.english: a very fast speed

detailed_translations.chinese: 飞驰；急速进行；急急忙忙地说
detailed_translations.english: if a horse gallops, it moves very fast with all its feet leaving the ground together

name: garret
trans: n. 阁楼；顶楼

name: grateful
trans: adj. 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的 副 词: gratefully

sentences.english: Our grateful thanks go to all who participated.
sentences.chinese: 我们衷心感谢所有参与者。

sentences.english: She gave me a grateful look.
sentences.chinese: 她感激地看了我一眼。

detailed_translations.chinese: 感谢的；令人愉快的，宜人的
detailed_translations.english: feeling that you want to thank someone because of something kind that they have done, or showing this feeling

name: grip
trans: n. 紧握，抓牢; 掌握，控制; 理解力，控制力; 握法，手法; 发夹；把手; vt. & vi. 紧握，抓紧; 吸引，引起 时 态: gripped，gripping，grips ...

sentences.english: Hold the microphone in a firm grip and keep it still.
sentences.chinese: 紧紧握住麦克风不要让它动。

sentences.english: She felt her wrist caught in a vice-like grip .
sentences.chinese: 她觉得手腕像是卡在铁钳里被牢牢地抓住了。

sentences.english: Don’t loosen your grip on the rope or you’ll fall.
sentences.chinese: 抓住绳索别松手，不然你会掉下去。

sentences.english: He released his grip and stepped back.
sentences.chinese: 他放开手往后退去。

detailed_translations.english: the way you hold something tightly, or your ability to do this

name: guardian
trans: n. 监护人，保护人；守护者; adj. 守护的 名 词: guardianship

sentences.english: Destiny's legal guardian was her grandmother.
sentences.chinese: 德斯蒂妮的法定监护人是她的祖母。

detailed_translations.chinese: [法] 监护人，保护人；守护者
detailed_translations.english: someone who is legally responsible for looking after someone else’s child, especially after the child’s parents have died

name: halve
trans: vt. 把…分成两半；把…减半时 态: halved，halving，halves

sentences.english: Cash cuts have halved the number of places available on training courses.
sentences.chinese: 经费削减使培训名额减少了一半。

detailed_translations.english: to reduce something by a half

name: handicap
trans: n. 障碍; 缺陷；残疾; 加给强对手的不利条件; vt. 妨碍；使不利; 使行动和生活不正常 时 态: handicapped，handicapping，handicaps

sentences.english: Not speaking the language is a real handicap.
sentences.chinese: 不会讲这种语言的确是一个障碍。

detailed_translations.english: a situation that makes it difficult for someone to do what they want
to make it difficult for someone to do something that they want or need to do

name: handy
trans: adj. 手边的，就近的；便利的；容易取得的；敏捷的 比较级: handier, handiest 名 词: handiness

sentences.english: It’s quite a handy little tool.
sentences.chinese: 这件小工具非常有用。

sentences.english: It’s very handy having a light above your desk.
sentences.chinese: 书桌上方有盏灯很有用。

sentences.english: Take your swimming trunks with you – they might come in handy (= be useful ).
sentences.chinese: 带上你的游泳裤，可能会派上用场的。

detailed_translations.english: useful

name: haphazard
trans: adj. 偶然的, 随意的, 无计划的副 词: haphazardly

sentences.english: It was strings of words borrowed from the different languages around them and put together in sort of haphazard ways.
sentences.chinese: 它只不过是从身边的不同语言当中,借用了一些单词串,以随意的方式将它们放在一起

sentences.english: All the master had to do was shake the tree a little and the garden was full of leaves again, spread out in haphazard patterns.
sentences.chinese: 大师什么都没有做，只是摇了摇树。 花园又重新被凋落的树叶覆盖了，整个花园展现出随意的样式。

name: heaven
trans: n. 天堂；天空；极乐

sentences.english: He believed that he and his wife would one day be together again in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 他相信他和妻子有一天会在天国重聚。

sentences.english: He looked up towards the heavens.
sentences.chinese: 他仰望苍穹。

detailed_translations.english: the place where God is believed to live and where good people are believed to go when they die

name: heel
trans: n. 足跟；踵部，后跟; vt. & vi. 倾斜 时 态: heeled，heeling，heels

sentences.english: black boots with high heels
sentences.chinese: 有高跟的黑靴子

detailed_translations.english: the curved back part of your foot
(of a vessel) to lean over; list

name: heighten
trans: vt. 提高；加强；增高；使更显著; vi. 升高；变强 时 态: heightened, heightening, heightens

sentences.english: There are fears that the march will heighten racial tension.
sentences.chinese: 有人担心这次游行会加深种族间的紧张局势。

sentences.english: Increased levels of fat in the diet could heighten the risk of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 饮食中脂肪摄入量的提升会增加患癌症的风险。

detailed_translations.english: if something heightens a feeling, effect etc, or if a feeling etc heightens, it becomes stronger or increases

name: heredity
trans: n. 遗传

sentences.english: Heredity is not a factor in causing the cancer.
sentences.chinese: 遗传并非导致这种癌症的一个因素。

detailed_translations.english: the process by which mental and physical qualities are passed from a parent to a child before the child is born

name: heroic
trans: adj. 有英雄气概的, 英雄的, 英勇的副 词: heroically

sentences.english: her heroic efforts to save her family
sentences.chinese: 她拯救家人的英勇行为

sentences.english: Lawrence’s heroic struggle against his destiny
sentences.chinese: 劳伦斯与命运的勇敢抗争

sentences.english: She portrayed him as a heroic figure .
sentences.chinese: 她把他描述为英雄人物。

sentences.english: He said his advice was: "No heroics, stay within the law."
sentences.chinese: 他说他的意见是：“不要有逞能行为，要依法办事。”

detailed_translations.chinese: 英雄的；英勇的；记叙英雄及其事迹的；夸张的
detailed_translations.english: extremely brave or determined, and admired by many people
If you describe someone's actions or plans as heroics, you think that they are foolish or dangerous because they are too difficult or brave for the situation in which they occur

name: hesitation
trans: n. 犹豫, 踌躇, 不愿; 犹豫

sentences.english: After some hesitation one of them began to speak.
sentences.chinese: 犹豫了一会儿之后，他们中有一个人开口了。

detailed_translations.english: when someone hesitates

name: heyday
trans: n. 最成功,最繁荣,最强盛等的时期

sentences.english: In its heyday, the studio's boast was that it had more stars than there are in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 该制片厂吹嘘，它在鼎盛时期拥有的明星比天上的星星还多。

detailed_translations.english: the time when someone or something was most popular, successful, or powerful

name: hint
trans: n. 暗示；线索; vt. 暗示；示意; vi. 示意 时 态: hinted, hinting, hints

sentences.english: There have been hints that he may take up coaching.
sentences.chinese: 他暗示过可能会出任教练。

sentences.english: ‘Look, I can’t tell you.’ ‘Oh, come on, give me a hint .’
sentences.chinese: “听着，我不能告诉你。”“得了，给我一点暗示吧。”

sentences.english: I made it clear I wasn’t interested in him, but he didn’t take the hint .
sentences.chinese: 我清楚地表明我对他不感兴趣，但他不明白我的意思。

detailed_translations.english: something that you say or do to suggest something to someone, without telling them directly
to suggest something in an indirect way, but so that someone can guess your meaning

name: holistic
trans: adj. 全部的

sentences.english: a holistic approach to design
sentences.chinese: 设计的整体方法

detailed_translations.english: considering a person or thing as a whole, rather than as separate parts

name: honour
trans: n. 荣誉；尊敬；勋章; vt. 尊敬；承兑；承兑远期票据

sentences.english: He was showered with honours – among them an Oscar.
sentences.chinese: 他获得了很多荣誉–其中包括奥斯卡奖。

detailed_translations.english: the respect that you, your family, your country etc receive from other people, which makes you feel proud

detailed_translations.chinese: 尊敬；[金融] 承兑；承兑远期票据
detailed_translations.english: to treat someone with special respect

name: hop
trans: vi. 单足蹦跳, 跳跃; 跳上; vt. 跃过, 跳过; 搭乘; n. 蹦跳, 跳跃; 跳舞; 一次飞行的距离 HOPabbr. High Oxygen Pressure 高氧压时 ...

sentences.english: a little girl hopping and skipping
sentences.chinese: 一个蹦蹦跳跳的小女孩

detailed_translations.chinese: 单足跳跃，单足跳行；齐足跳跃，齐足跳行
detailed_translations.english: to move by jumping on one foot
to move by jumping on one foot
a short jump

name: humble
trans: adj. 谦逊的, 谦虚的; 低下的, 卑微的; 简陋的, 低劣的; vt. 使谦恭, 使卑下 比较级: humbler, humblest 名 词: humbleness ...

sentences.english: a modest and humble man
sentences.chinese: 一个谦卑的男人

sentences.english: Honda won fame in the 1980s as the little car company that humbled the industry giants.
sentences.chinese: 20世纪80年代，本田作为一家小型汽车公司因一举击垮行业巨头而声名鹊起。

detailed_translations.chinese: 谦逊的；简陋的；（级别或地位）低下的；不大的
detailed_translations.english: not considering yourself or your ideas to be as important as other people’s

detailed_translations.chinese: 使谦恭；轻松打败（尤指强大的对手）；低声下气
detailed_translations.english: If you humble someone who is more important or powerful than you, you defeat them easily

name: humid
trans: adj. 潮湿的；湿润的；多湿气的

sentences.english: Tokyo is extremely humid in mid-summer.
sentences.chinese: 仲夏的东京十分潮湿。

detailed_translations.english: if the weather is humid, you feel uncomfortable because the air is very wet and usually hot

name: hurl
trans: vt. 丢下；用力投掷；愤慨地说出; vi. 猛投；猛掷; n. 用力的投掷 时 态: hurled, hurling, hurls 名 词: hurl 名 词: ...

sentences.english: Demonstrators were hurling bricks through the windows.
sentences.chinese: 示威者在向窗里掷砖块。

sentences.english: He hurled a chair across the set, smashing lamps and vases.
sentences.chinese: 他抓起一把椅子扔向片场的那头，把灯和花瓶都砸得粉碎。

detailed_translations.english: to throw something with a lot of force, especially because you are angry

name: hypothetical
trans: adj. 假设的，假定的；有待证实的名 词: hypothetical 副 词: hypothetically

sentences.english: The question is purely hypothetical .
sentences.chinese: 这个问题完全基于假设。

detailed_translations.english: based on a situation that is not real, but that might happen

name: illuminate
trans: vt. 使明亮；照亮; 装饰; 说明，阐明 时 态: illuminated，illuminating，illuminates 副 词: illuminatingly

sentences.english: A single candle illuminated his face.
sentences.chinese: 一支蜡烛照亮了他的脸。

sentences.english: The report illuminated the difficult issues at the heart of science policy.
sentences.chinese: 报告阐明了科学方针核心部分的难点。

detailed_translations.english: to make a light shine on something, or to fill a place with light

name: immobile
trans: adj. 不能活动的, 不能移动的; 不活动的, 静止的 名 词: immobility

sentences.english: She could see a figure sitting immobile, facing the sea.
sentences.chinese: 她看到一个人影面朝大海坐着，一动不动。

detailed_translations.english: not moving at all

name: impersonal
trans: adj. 不受个人情感影响的，冷淡的; 客观的; n. 与个人无关; adv. 冷淡地；客观地 名 词: impersonality 副 词: impersonally

sentences.english: Business letters do not have to be impersonal and formal.
sentences.chinese: 商业信函并非一定要刻板而缺乏人情味。

sentences.english: Sometimes she seems a very impersonal, even unkind, mother.
sentences.chinese: 有时她看起来是一个非常冷漠的母亲，甚至有些刻薄。

detailed_translations.chinese: 客观的；非个人的；没有人情味的；非人称的
detailed_translations.english: not showing any feelings of sympathy, friendliness etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 非人称动词；不具人格的事物

name: implementation
trans: n. 贯彻，执行

sentences.english: They do, however, greatly affect the implementation of those patterns.
sentences.chinese: 然而，它们的确对那些模式的 实现影响很大。

sentences.english: If I now scroll down to the actual implementation, now does this work or not work?
sentences.chinese: 如果现在我向下滚动到实际的执行中，这个是可用的还是不可用的呢？

sentences.english: One file describes the interface to your service, while the other file describes your implementation of it.
sentences.chinese: 一个文件描述到您的服务的接口，而另一个文件描述这个接口的实现。

name: imply
trans: vt. 暗示；意味；隐含 时 态: implied, implying, implies

sentences.english: an implied threat
sentences.chinese: 隐含的威胁

sentences.english: The high level of radiation in the rocks implies that they are volcanic in origin.
sentences.chinese: 这些岩石内的高辐射水平显示它们是由火山作用形成的。

detailed_translations.english: to suggest that something is true, without saying this directly

name: impractical
trans: adj. 不切实际的, 无用的, 不现实的; 不善做实际工作的 名 词: impracticality

sentences.english: The road toll scheme was dismissed as impractical.
sentences.chinese: 公路收费计划由于不切实际而遭到否定。

sentences.english: James was a foolish man, full of impractical plans.
sentences.chinese: 詹姆斯是个愚蠢的人，满脑子都是不切实际的计划。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不切实际的，不现实的；不能实行的
detailed_translations.english: not sensible or possible for practical reasons

name: inaccurate
trans: adj. 有错误的,不正确的; adv. 不精密地,不准确地

sentences.english: This is a silly and inaccurate way to think about time, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，这是一种愚蠢和错误的看待时间的方法。

sentences.english: It could also be an invalidation notice specifying that part of data should not be considered in the integration process because it is inaccurate.
sentences.chinese: 它经常是一个无效的通告，部分的数据集成过程中应该不会被考虑，因为他们是错误的。

name: inappropriate
trans: adj. 不恰当的, 不适宜的副 词: inappropriately

sentences.english: There is no suggestion that clients have been sold inappropriate policies.
sentences.chinese: 没有迹象表明向客户出售过不适当的保险单。

detailed_translations.english: not suitable or right for a particular purpose or in a particular situation

name: incendiary
trans: adj. 放火的, 纵火的, 能燃烧的; 煽动性的 名 词: incendiarism

sentences.english: A shower of incendiaries struck the Opera House.
sentences.chinese: 阵雨般的燃烧弹击中了歌剧院。

detailed_translations.chinese: 燃烧弹；纵火犯，放火者；煽动者
detailed_translations.english: a bomb designed to cause a fire
an incendiary speech, piece of writing etc is intended to make people angry

name: indiscriminate
trans: adj. 不加区别的, 不加选择的, 不加鉴别的, 不分好坏的副 词: indiscriminately

sentences.english: the indiscriminate use of chemical fertilizers
sentences.chinese: 化肥的滥用

detailed_translations.chinese: 任意的；无差别的；不分皂白的
detailed_translations.english: an indiscriminate action is done without thinking about what harm it might cause

name: indispensable
trans: adj. 必不可少的, 必需的; n. 不可缺少之物 副 词: indispensably

sentences.english: Mobile phones have become an indispensable part of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 移动电话已经成为我们生活中的必需品。

detailed_translations.english: someone or something that is indispensable is so important or useful that it is impossible to manage without them

name: indulge
trans: vt. 满足；使沉迷于…；使高兴；纵容; vi. 满足；沉溺；放任 时 态: indulged, indulging, indulges

sentences.english: Only rarely will she indulge in a glass of wine.
sentences.chinese: 她只是偶尔才会喝上杯葡萄酒。

sentences.english: He returned to Ohio so that he could indulge his passion for football.
sentences.chinese: 他重返俄亥俄以释放自己对足球的激情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 沉溺， 纵容自己， 肆意从事
detailed_translations.english: If you indulge in something or if you indulge yourself, you allow yourself to have or do something that you know you will enjoy

detailed_translations.chinese: 使沉溺于，满足；纵容，迁就
detailed_translations.english: to let someone have or do whatever they want, even if it is bad for them

name: inefficient

sentences.english: What is obesity?
sentences.chinese: 什么是肥胖？

detailed_translations.english: when someone is very fat in a way that is unhealthy

trans: adj. 感激的；有责任的；必须的; v. 要求；约束；施恩惠

name: obscure
trans: adj. 无名的；鲜为人知的；默默无闻的; 费解的，晦涩的；模糊的，朦胧的；不清楚的; v. 遮掩；遮蔽；使不分明; 隐藏，掩盖；使难理解，使晦涩 比较级: obscurer, o...

sentences.english: an obscure poet
sentences.chinese: 名不见经传的诗人

sentences.english: The details of his life remain obscure.
sentences.chinese: 他的生平不详。

sentences.chinese: 树木遮住了他的视线，他不怎么看得见广场南半部。

If one thing obscures another, it prevents it from being seen or heard properly

name: occasional
trans: adj. 偶尔的, 不经常的

sentences.chinese: 他有时候会去伦敦。

sentences.chinese: 他们偶尔会在购物后一起喝杯咖啡。

sentences.chinese: 他只是偶尔用一下汽车。

sentences.english: We should have enough money for the occasional trip.
sentences.chinese: 我们的钱应该足够偶尔出去旅行一次的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 偶尔的， 间或发生的
detailed_translations.english: happening sometimes but not often or regularly

name: ongoing
trans: adj. 前进的；不间断的，进行的; n. 前进；行为，举止

sentences.chinese: 他们仍在寻找一个新主任

sentences.chinese: 还在进行的谈判

sentences.english: The discussions are still ongoing.
sentences.chinese: 讨论仍在继续。

detailed_translations.english: continuing, or continuing to develop

name: opulence
trans: n. 富裕,富饶

sentences.english: They have concentrated on a opulence life style and realize thepoor working man who has seen very little benefit from the sale of oil is notgoing to come to their rescue.
sentences.chinese: 他们现在过着富裕的生活，并意识到那些从石油销售中没有获得多少好处的贫穷工人是不会来拯救他们的。

sentences.english: We believe our clients are more sophisticated they believe in a lifestyle of improved working environment, we believe this means opulence is not sufficient and more tools will be required.
sentences.chinese: 我们认为客户更复杂，他们信仰改善工作环境的生活方式，我们认为这意味空间的富裕是不够的，需要更多的工具。

name: orchard
trans: n. 果园；果树林

sentences.english: a cherry orchard
sentences.chinese: 樱桃园

detailed_translations.english: a place where fruit trees are grown

name: orient
trans: vt. 使熟悉，使适应; 使朝向；使确定位置; n. 东方，亚洲 时 态: oriented，orienting，orients

sentences.english: She looked at the street names, trying to orient herself.
sentences.chinese: 她看看街名，试图确定自己的方位。

detailed_translations.chinese: 使适应；确定方向；使朝东

the eastern part of the world, especially China and Japan
to find exactly where you are by looking around you or using a map

name: outdated
trans: adj. 过时的；旧式的; v. 使过时

sentences.chinese: 不合时宜的教学方法

sentences.chinese: 设备陈旧的工厂

sentences.chinese: 他的写作风格如今已显得乏味而过时了。

detailed_translations.english: if something is outdated, it is no longer considered useful or effective, because something more modern exists

name: outlook
trans: n. 展望；态度，观点；景色 vt. 比……好看；用目光压倒 vi. 朝外看 Outlook由Microsoft公司研制的收发邮件的软件

sentences.english: Exercise will improve your looks and your outlook.
sentences.chinese: 运动将会改善你的外在形象和人生态度。

detailed_translations.english: your general attitude to life and the world

name: output
trans: n. 产量；输出，输出量；出产; vt. 输出 时 态: outputted , output outputting, outputs

sentences.english: Output is up 30% on last year.
sentences.chinese: 产量比去年提高了30%。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of goods or work produced by a person, machine, factory etc
if a computer outputs information, it produces it

name: outset
trans: n. 开始, 开端

sentences.english: It was clear from the outset that there were going to be problems.
sentences.chinese: 从一开始就很清楚会有问题出现的。

sentences.english: It’s better to get something in writing right at the outset.
sentences.chinese: 最好一开始就有个书面的东西。

detailed_translations.english: at or from the beginning of an event or process

trans: n. 外围地区, 郊区, 郊外

sentences.chinese: 这堆碎石后来被倾倒在佛罗伦萨市郊的一处垃圾填埋场。

sentences.chinese: 在我造访的每个城市的郊区，一栋栋在建公寓楼确实是鳞次栉比。

sentences.chinese: 在抛弃大马士革郊区破坏殆尽的家后，穆斯塔法和他的妻子，孩子几年迈的父母花了几个月的时间在一个又一个小镇躲避战祸。

detailed_translations.english: the parts of a town or city that are furthest from the centre

name: overhang
trans: vt. & vi. 伸出；悬挂于…之上时 态: overhung overhanging，overhangs

sentences.chinese: 部分岩壁悬在了小径一处的上方。

detailed_translations.english: to hang over something or stick out above it

name: overheads
trans: n. 经费

name: overload
trans: vt. 使负担太重; 使超载, 使过载 时 态: overloaded, overloading, overloads

sentences.english: 57 percent complained of work overload.
sentences.chinese: 57%的人抱怨工作负担过重。

detailed_translations.english: too much of sth

name: overly
trans: adv. 过度地

sentences.chinese: 雇主在雇用新员工的问题上可能会过于谨慎。

detailed_translations.english: Overly means more than is normal, necessary, or reasonable

trans: vt. 过高估计；对…估价过高 时 态: overrated, overrating, overrates

sentences.chinese: 更多的男士正发现工作的种种乐趣被高估了。

trans: vt. 赶上；压倒；突然来袭; vi. 超车 时 态: overtook overtaken overtaking, overtakes

sentences.english: He pulled out to overtake the van.
sentences.chinese: 他把车驶出所在车道想超过那辆小货车。

sentences.english: Never try to overtake on a bend.
sentences.chinese: 绝不要在转弯处超车。

detailed_translations.english: to go past a moving vehicle or person because you are going faster than them and want to get in front of them

name: overuse
trans: n. 过度使用; vt. 把…使用过度 时 态: overused, overusing, overuses

sentences.chinese: 学生往往会滥用某些词语。

detailed_translations.english: to use something too much, especially so that it is not effective any more or it is damaged

trans: n. 票面价值；平均数量；标准; adj. 标准的；票面的 PARabbr. Peak Average Rectified 修正的峰值平均值时 态: parred, parri...

sentences.chinese: 最后一洞的标准杆数为五杆。

detailed_translations.chinese: 标准；票面价值；平均数量
detailed_translations.english: the number of  stroke s  a good player should take to hit the ball into a hole in the game of  golf

trans: n. 议会, 国会

sentences.chinese: 他们要求议会自由和新闻自由。

detailed_translations.english: the group of people who are elected to make a country’s laws and discuss important national affairs

name: partnership
trans: n. 伙伴关系; 合伙人身份; 合作关系; 合作; 合伙企业

sentences.chinese: 它是该国最成功的合伙企业之一。

detailed_translations.chinese: 合伙；[经管] 合伙企业；合作关系；合伙契约
detailed_translations.english: the state of being a partner in business

name: patch

sentences.chinese: 小心路上结冰的地方。

sentences.chinese: 胸部有一块白斑的猫

sentences.chinese: 他把头发梳过来盖住秃掉的地方。

trans: adj. 知觉的,有知觉的

sentences.chinese: 财力不足从最初起就一直是个问题。

detailed_translations.chinese: 多年生的；常年的；四季不断的；常在的；反复的

a plant that lives for more than two years

name: perpetuate
trans: vt. 使永存；使人记住不忘时 态: perpetuated，perpetuating，perpetuates 名 词: perpetuator

sentences.english: an education system that perpetuates the divisions in our society
sentences.chinese: 使我们的社会持续分化的一种教育制度

name: personalise
trans: vt. 在作物主标志; 使针对个人、带有个人感情或个性化

trans: adj. 悲观的; 悲观主义的

sentences.english: a pessimistic view of life
sentences.chinese: 对人生的悲观看法

detailed_translations.english: expecting that bad things will happen in the future or that something will have a bad result

trans: n. 污染者；污染源；污染物质

trans: n. 招贴, 海报; 印成的大幅画

sentences.chinese: 一队志愿者正在张贴海报。

sentences.english: a poster campaign for the election
sentences.chinese: 选举的海报宣传

detailed_translations.english: a large printed notice, picture, or photograph, used to advertise something or as a decoration

sentences.chinese: …一个家禽饲养场。

detailed_translations.english: birds such as chickens and ducks that are kept on farms in order to produce eggs and meat

trans: adj. 可行的; 适用的名 词: practicability 副 词: practicably

sentences.chinese: 唯一可行的做法是把公司卖掉。

sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪总统的前任是战争英雄德怀特·艾森豪威尔。

sentences.chinese: 英格兰和威尔士普遍的经济状况

trans: adv. 主要地

sentences.chinese: 这笔钱主要投资于股票。

sentences.english: He was principally a landscape painter.
sentences.chinese: 他主要是风景画画家。

sentences.english: We met principally to discuss the future of the school.
sentences.chinese: 我们开会主要是为了商讨学校的前途。

name: procurement
trans: n. 获得;采购

sentences.chinese: 他说俄罗斯正“以大约百分之八十的幅度”削减新武器的补给。

name: promptly
trans: adv. 敏捷地；迅速地；立即地; 准时地，正好

sentences.english: A reply came very promptly.
sentences.chinese: 马上就有了答复。

sentences.chinese: 这个团体建了一个网站来宣扬他们的主张。

sentences.english: The plant can be propagated from seed.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物可由种子繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: to spread an idea, belief etc to many people

trans: vt. 按比例分配; vi. 按比例分配 时 态: prorated, prorating, prorates 名 词: proration

sentences.english: If weather and/or sea conditions cause your trip to return early, the boat fare will be prorated.
sentences.chinese: 如果因天气和/或海上的原因导致提前返程，会按比例退还船费。

name: prosperous
trans: adj. 成功的, 繁荣的, 兴旺的副 词: prosperously

sentences.english: a prosperous landowner
sentences.chinese: 富裕的土地拥有者

detailed_translations.english: rich and successful

name: punctual
trans: adj. 准时的，守时的；精确的 名 词: punctuality 副 词: punctually

sentences.english: She’s always very punctual for appointments.
sentences.chinese: 她一向准时赴约。

sentences.english: the punctual payment of invoices
sentences.chinese: 准时结清费用清单

detailed_translations.english: arriving, happening, or being done at exactly the time that has been arranged

name: purse
trans: n. 钱包，小钱袋；金钱，财源; vt. 皱起，缩拢 时 态: pursed, pursing, purses

sentences.english: I locked the door and dropped the keys in my purse.
sentences.chinese: 我锁上门，然后把钥匙丢进手提包里。

detailed_translations.chinese: (女士)手提袋；(国家、家庭、团体等的) 财力
detailed_translations.english: a bag in which a woman carries her money and personal things
if you purse your lips, you bring them together tightly into a small circle, especially to show disapproval or doubt

name: quadruple
trans: adj. 四倍的；四重的；四部组成的; n. 四倍数; vt. & vi. 成四倍 时 态: quadrupled，quadrupling，quadruples 副 词: q...

sentences.english: The subjects were given quadruple the normal dosage of the drug.
sentences.chinese: 让实验对象服用了四倍于正常剂量的药物。

detailed_translations.english: four times as big or as many
to increase and become four times as big or as high, or to make something increase in this way

name: quit
trans: vt. & vi. 从离开；离去; vt. 停止 时 态: quit ，quitted quitting，quits

sentences.english: He quit his job after an argument with a colleague.
sentences.chinese: 他和一个同事争吵后就辞职了。

sentences.english: I quit school at 16.
sentences.chinese: 我十六岁辍学。

sentences.english: She has decided to quit show business.
sentences.chinese: 她已决定退出娱乐圈。

sentences.english: People are now calling on the chairman to quit.
sentences.chinese: 人们现在正要求主席辞职。

sentences.english: I've quit smoking.
sentences.chinese: 我戒了烟。

detailed_translations.english: to leave a job, school etc, especially without finishing it completely

name: quota
trans: n. 定量, 定额, 配额

sentences.english: The government has decided to scrap quotas on car imports.
sentences.chinese: 政府决定取消汽车进口配额。

sentences.english: There are plans to introduce strict immigration quotas.
sentences.chinese: 有计划要推行严格的移民限额制度。

detailed_translations.english: an official limit on the number or amount of something that is allowed in a particular period

name: racket
trans: n. 球拍; 吵闹声; 敲诈, 勒索, 诈骗, 非法勾当 时 态: racketed, racketing, rackets

sentences.english: The old machine used to make an awful racket .
sentences.chinese: 这台旧机器以前噪音大得吓人。

detailed_translations.english: a loud noise

name: radius
trans: n. 半径，半径范围；辐射光线；有效航程；桡骨 复 数: radii

sentences.english: The shock of the explosion was felt over a radius of forty miles.
sentences.chinese: 爆炸引起的剧烈震动在方圆40英里内都能感觉得到。
