name: ration
trans: n. 定量；配给量; vt. 限量供应；配给供应 时 态: rationed，rationing，rations

sentences.english: Fuel was rationed during the war.
sentences.chinese: 战争期间，燃油定量供应。

detailed_translations.english: to control the supply of something because there is not enough
a fixed amount of something that people are allowed to have when there is not enough, for example during a war

name: recipient
trans: n. 接受者

sentences.english: ...the largest recipient of U.S. foreign aid.
sentences.chinese: …最大的美国对外援助接受方。

detailed_translations.english: someone who receives something

name: rectangular
trans: adj. 〈数〉长方形的; 矩形的名 词: rectangularity

sentences.english: ...a rectangular table.
sentences.chinese: …一张长方形的桌子。

detailed_translations.english: having the shape of a rectangle

name: redundant
trans: adj. 因人员过剩而被解雇的; 不需要的; 多余的 副 词: redundantly

sentences.english: Seventy factory workers were made redundant in the resulting cuts.
sentences.chinese: 在继而发生的裁员中，70名工厂工人被解雇。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过剩的；失业的，被解雇的
detailed_translations.english: if you are redundant, your employer no longer has a job for you

name: refresh
trans: vt. 使……恢复；更新；使……清新；消除……的疲劳; vi. 恢复精神；喝饮料，吃点心；补充给养 时 态: refreshed, refreshing, refreshes

sentences.english: A shower will refresh you.
sentences.chinese: 洗个淋浴你就凉快了。

sentences.english: He refreshed himself with a glass of iced tea.
sentences.chinese: 他喝了杯冰茶提了提神。

detailed_translations.english: to make someone feel less tired or less hot

name: regain
trans: vt. 复得；赢回; 重回，复至某地 时 态: regained，regaining，regains

sentences.english: The family never quite regained its former influence.
sentences.chinese: 这个家族再也没有恢复往昔的影响力。

sentences.english: He somehow managed to regain his balance .
sentences.chinese: 他总算恢复了平衡。

sentences.english: Government forces have regained control of the city.
sentences.chinese: 政府军已重新控制了这座城市。

sentences.english: When she regained consciousness (= woke up after being unconscious ) , she was lying on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她恢复知觉醒来时，正躺在地板上。

sentences.english: He looked stunned, but he soon regain ed his composure (= became calm again ) .
sentences.chinese: 他似乎愣了愣，但很快就恢复平静了。

sentences.english: The doctors don’t know if he will ever regain the use of his legs.
sentences.chinese: 医生们不知道他的腿是否还能恢复功能。

detailed_translations.english: to get something back, especially an ability or quality, that you have lost

name: regenerate
trans: vt. & vi. 新生；再生时 态: regenerated，regenerating，regenerates 名 词: regenerator

sentences.english: Small nodules form as the liver cells regenerate.
sentences.chinese: 肝细胞再生时会形成一些小结节。

detailed_translations.chinese: 新生， 再生， 起革新作用
detailed_translations.english: to grow again, or make something grow again
to grow again, or make something grow again

name: relic
trans: n. 遗物, 遗迹, 遗产; 遗体, 尸骸

sentences.english: Roman relics found in a field
sentences.chinese: 在野外发现的古罗马遗迹

detailed_translations.english: an old object or custom that reminds people of the past or that has lived on from a past time

name: remark
trans: n. 话语，评论; 注意；看；观察; vt. & vi. 谈论，评论; vt. 注意到… 时 态: remarked，remarking，remarks

sentences.english: to make a remark
sentences.chinese: 发表评论

sentences.english: Critics remarked that the play was not original.
sentences.chinese: 评论家们指出这部戏剧缺乏创意

detailed_translations.english: something that you say when you express an opinion or say what you have noticed
to say or write a comment about sth/sb

name: residue
trans: n. 残渣；剩余；滤渣

sentences.english: The flies leave a sticky residue on crops.
sentences.chinese: 苍蝇在庄稼上留下黏糊糊的分泌物。

sentences.english: Rinse off any soap residue.
sentences.chinese: 冲净残留的肥皂。

detailed_translations.english: a substance that remains on a surface, in a container etc and cannot be removed easily, or that remains after a chemical process

name: resonance
trans: n. 回响，回荡；洪亮；共鸣

sentences.english: a tradition that has little resonance in the 21st century
sentences.chinese: 在21世纪难以引起共鸣的传统

sentences.english: His words will have resonance for many musicians.
sentences.chinese: 他的话将在很多音乐家心里产生共鸣。

detailed_translations.english: the special meaning or importance that something has for you because it relates to your own experiences

name: retard
trans: vt. 使减速；妨碍；阻止; 推迟，延迟; 使延迟; vi. 减慢；受到阻滞; n. 减速；阻滞；延迟 时 态: retarded，retarding，retards 名 词: ...

sentences.english: Cold weather retards the growth of many plants.
sentences.chinese: 寒冷的天气使许多植物生长滞缓。

detailed_translations.english: to delay the development of something, or to make something happen more slowly than expected

name: retreat
trans: n. 撤退；休息寓所；撤退; vi. 撤退；退避；向后倾; vt. 使后退；退 时 态: retreated, retreating, retreats 名 词: ret...

sentences.english: Napoleon’s retreat from Moscow
sentences.chinese: 拿破仑从莫斯科的撤退

sentences.english: The rebel forces are in full retreat (= retreating very fast ) .
sentences.chinese: 叛军全线溃退。

sentences.english: The bugler sounded the retreat (= gave a loud signal for retreat ) .
sentences.chinese: 司号兵吹响撤退号。

detailed_translations.english: a movement away from the enemy after a defeat in battle
to move away from the enemy after being defeated in battle

name: retrenchment
trans: n. 节省,删除

sentences.english: Defence planners predict an extended period of retrenchment.
sentences.chinese: 国防规划人员们预计，开支紧缩期会延长。

detailed_translations.english: Retrenchment means spending less money

name: revitalise
trans: vt. 使恢复元气,使具有新的活力

name: revive
trans: vi. 苏醒；复兴；复活；恢复精神; vt. 使苏醒；使复兴；回想起；重演，重播 时 态: revived, reviving, revives 形容词: revivab...

sentences.english: Local people have decided to revive this centuries-old tradition.
sentences.chinese: 当地人决定复兴这一延续了数个世纪的传统。

sentences.english: an attempt to revive the steel industry
sentences.chinese: 复苏钢铁工业的努力

sentences.english: The doctors revived her with injections of glucose.
sentences.chinese: 医生给她注射葡萄糖，使她苏醒过来。

detailed_translations.english: to bring something back after it has not been used or has not existed for a period of time

name: sacrifice
trans: n. 牺牲, 舍身; 献祭, 供奉; 祭品; vt. & vi. 献祭; vt. 牺牲, 献出 时 态: sacrificed, sacrificing, sacrifices

sentences.english: The minister stressed the need for economic sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 部长强调了在经济上作出牺牲的必要性。

sentences.english: The workforce were willing to make sacrifices in order to preserve jobs.
sentences.chinese: 雇员为了保住饭碗情愿作出牺牲。

sentences.english: She brought three children up single-handedly, often at great personal sacrifice.
sentences.chinese: 她独自一人把三个孩子带大，常常需要作出巨大的个人牺牲。

sentences.english: They made sacrifices to ensure a good harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们举行献祭以保丰收。

sentences.english: He sacrificed a promising career to look after his kids.
sentences.chinese: 他为了照看孩子牺牲了很有前途的事业。

detailed_translations.english: when you decide not to have something valuable, in order to get something that is more important
to willingly stop having something you want or doing something you like in order to get something more important

name: sanction
trans: n. 制裁，处罚；认可；支持; vt. 制裁，处罚；批准；鼓励 时 态: sanctioned, sanctioning, sanctions

sentences.english: a resolution to impose sanctions (= start using sanctions ) on DPRK
sentences.chinese: 对朝鲜实施制裁的决议

sentences.english: the threat of trade sanctions
sentences.chinese: 贸易制裁的威胁

sentences.english: The UN security council may impose economic sanctions .
sentences.chinese: 联合国安理会可能会实施经济制裁。

sentences.english: Any talk about lifting sanctions (= ending them ) is premature.
sentences.chinese: 现时就谈取消制裁为时过早。

detailed_translations.english: official orders or laws stopping trade, communication etc with another country, as a way of forcing its leaders to make political changes
to officially accept or allow something

name: saver
trans: n. 救助者；节俭的人；节约装置

sentences.english: Mutual funds have been attractive to small savers (= people who save small amounts of money ) .
sentences.chinese: 共同基金对小额储户很有吸引力。

detailed_translations.chinese: 救助者；节俭的人；节约装置

name: scenario
trans: n. 情节；剧本；方案

sentences.english: The conflict degenerating into civil war is everybody's nightmare scenario.
sentences.chinese: 这场冲突恶化成内战成为每个人的恶梦。

detailed_translations.english: a written description of the characters, place, and things that will happen in a film, play etc

name: scepticism
trans: n. 怀疑态度;怀疑论

sentences.english: A survey reflects business scepticism about the strength of the economic recovery.
sentences.chinese: 一份调查反映出商业界对经济恢复能力的怀疑。

detailed_translations.english: an attitude of doubting that particular claims or statements are true or that something will happen

name: scientifically
trans: adv. 合乎科学地

sentences.english: He explained scientifically the most important questions of political economy.
sentences.chinese: 他科学地阐述了政治经济学中一些最重要的问题。

sentences.english: The object of this society is to perfect its members practically and scientifically.
sentences.chinese: 这个社团的目的是实际地、科学地及充分地指导其成员。

name: scream
trans: vi. 尖叫；发出尖锐刺耳的声音；呼啸；令人触目惊心; vt. 尖声喊叫；大叫大嚷着要求; n. 尖叫声；尖锐刺耳的声音；极其滑稽可笑的人 时 态: screamed, screa...

sentences.english: After the first few shots, people started screaming.
sentences.chinese: 几声枪响过后，人们开始尖叫起来。

sentences.english: a screaming baby
sentences.chinese: 尖声哭叫的婴儿

sentences.english: The children were screaming with laughter .
sentences.chinese: 小孩子们在尖声欢笑。

sentences.english: She was screaming her head off (= screaming a lot ) .
sentences.chinese: 她不停地尖叫。

sentences.english: She began to scream blue murder (= scream very loudly ) .
sentences.chinese: 她开始高声尖叫。

sentences.english: He was dragged kicking and screaming to a nearby van.
sentences.chinese: 他又踢又叫着被拖到附近的一辆小货车上。

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖叫；呼啸；发出尖锐刺耳的声音；令人触目惊心
detailed_translations.english: to make a loud high noise with your voice because you are hurt, frightened, excited etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 尖叫声；尖锐刺耳的声音；极其滑稽可笑的人
detailed_translations.english: a loud high sound that you make with your voice because you are hurt, frightened, excited etc

name: scrutinise
trans: vt. 详细检查;细看; vi. 作详细检查;细阅

name: secrecy
trans: n. 保密；秘密；隐蔽

sentences.english: I must stress the need for absolute secrecy about the project.
sentences.chinese: 我必须强调这项计划一定要绝对保密。

sentences.english: His work was shrouded in secrecy .
sentences.chinese: 他的工作秘而不宣。

sentences.english: the veil of secrecy that covered the talks
sentences.chinese: 笼罩在会谈上的神秘面纱

detailed_translations.english: the process of keeping something secret, or when something is kept a secret

name: secrete
trans: vt. 藏匿；私下侵吞；分泌 时 态: secreted, secreting, secretes

sentences.english: The toad’s skin secretes a deadly poison.
sentences.chinese: 蟾蜍的皮肤会分泌一种致命毒素。

detailed_translations.english: if a part of an animal or plant secretes a liquid substance, it produces it

name: seize
trans: vt. & vi. 抓住，捉住; vt. 夺取；占领 时 态: seized，seizing，seizes 形容词: seizable 名 词: seizer

sentences.english: Suddenly he seized my hand.
sentences.chinese: 他突然抓住我的手。

sentences.english: The rebels have seized power.
sentences.chinese: 叛乱分子夺取了政权。

sentences.english: The gunmen were seized at 1 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 这几名持枪歹徒在凌晨1点被抓获。

detailed_translations.english: to take hold of something suddenly and violently

name: shame
trans: n. 羞耻，羞愧；憾事，带来耻辱的人; vt. 使丢脸，使羞愧 时 态: shamed, shaming, shames

sentences.english: He felt a deep sense of shame.
sentences.chinese: 他深深地感到羞愧。

sentences.english: Maria blushed with shame.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚羞得脸都红了。

sentences.english: (= it made her feel ashamed ) , she gained back all the weight she’d lost.
sentences.chinese: 让她感到惭愧的是，她减掉的体重全又长回来了。

sentences.english: He’s brought shame on the whole family.
sentences.chinese: 他使全家蒙羞。

sentences.english: (= it should not make you feel ashamed ) saying ‘I don’t know’.
sentences.chinese: 说一句"我不知道”也没什么可难为情的。

detailed_translations.chinese: 羞耻，羞愧；憾事，带来耻辱的人
detailed_translations.english: the feeling you have when you feel guilty and embarrassed because you, or someone who is close to you, have done something wrong
to make someone feel ashamed

name: sharpen
trans: v. 变锋利；改善，提高；加剧 时 态: sharpened, sharpening, sharpens 名 词: sharpener

sentences.english: Her gaze sharpened, as if she had seen something unusual.
sentences.chinese: 她眼睛一亮，好像看到了不寻常的东西。

sentences.english: He will need to sharpen his diplomatic skills in order to work with Congress.
sentences.chinese: 他将需要增强外交技巧以与国会打交道。

detailed_translations.chinese: 削尖， 磨快； 使敏锐， 使敏捷
detailed_translations.english: If your senses, understanding, or skills sharpen or are sharpened, you become better at noticing things, thinking, or doing something

name: shield
trans: n. 盾；防护物；保护者; vt. 保卫；包庇；遮蔽；避开; vi. 起保护作用；防御 时 态: shielded, shielding, shields

sentences.english: He clanged his sword three times on his shield.
sentences.chinese: 他用他的剑当当当地敲了3下盾。

sentences.english: He used his left hand as a shield against the reflecting sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 他用左手遮挡反射过来的阳光。

sentences.english: He held up his hands, shielding his eyes from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 他抬手遮住眼睛免受阳光照射。

detailed_translations.english: a large piece of metal or leather that soldiers used in the past to protect themselves when fighting
to protect someone or something from being harmed or damaged

name: shiny
trans: adj. 有光泽的，擦亮的；晴朗的；闪耀的；磨损的 比较级: shinier, shiniest 名 词: shininess

sentences.english: shiny black shoes
sentences.chinese: 锃亮的黑皮鞋

sentences.english: a shiny polished table
sentences.chinese: 擦得光亮的桌子

sentences.english: Her hair was thick and shiny.
sentences.chinese: 她的头发浓密且有光泽。

detailed_translations.english: smooth and bright

name: shoulder
trans: n. 肩, 肩部, 肩膀; 背的上部; 有责任的人; vt. 扛, 担, 挑; 用肩顶…; 承担 时 态: shouldered, shouldering, shoulders

sentences.english: The residents are being asked to shoulder the costs of the repairs.
sentences.chinese: 居民们被要求承担这笔修理费用。

sentences.english: They shouldered the boat and took it down to the river.
sentences.chinese: 他们把船扛在肩上抬到河里。

detailed_translations.english: to accept a difficult or unpleasant responsibility, duty etc

name: simultaneous
trans: adj. 同时发生的; 同时存在的副 词: simultaneously

sentences.english: They grabbed each other’s hands in simultaneous panic.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩同时惊慌起来，相互抓住对方的手。

sentences.english: Up to twenty users can have simultaneous access to the system.
sentences.chinese: 最多可有20名用户同时登该系统。

sentences.english: The speeches will be broadcast live, with simultaneous translation (= immediate translation, as the person is speaking ) into English.
sentences.chinese: 这些演讲将作现场直播，并配有英语同声传译。

detailed_translations.english: things that are simultaneous happen at exactly the same time

name: sizeable
trans: adj. 大的，相当大的

sentences.english: Harry inherited the house and a sizeable chunk of land.
sentences.chinese: 哈里继承了这座房子以及相当大的一片土地。

sentences.english: By and large the limbed tetrapods and near-tetrapods unearthed thus far have been sizeable beasts around a meter long.
sentences.chinese: 整体说来，目前发掘出的有肢四足动物或近四足动物，都是相当大的怪兽，体长约有一公尺。

detailed_translations.english: fairly large

name: smart
trans: adj. 整洁漂亮的；衣着讲究的；时髦的; 思维敏捷的，伶俐的；聪明的; 有力的，猛烈的; vi. 感到刺痛; n. 创伤 SMARTabbr. Satellite Maintena...

sentences.english: My eyes were smarting with the smoke.
sentences.chinese: 我的眼睛被烟熏得发痛。

detailed_translations.english: to feel a sharp stinging pain in a part of your body

name: soften
trans: vt. 使变柔软；使温和；使缓和; vi. 变柔和；变柔软；减轻 时 态: softened, softening, softens 名 词: softener

sentences.english: The government has softened its stance on public spending.
sentences.chinese: 政府对公共开支问题的态度软化了。

detailed_translations.english: to become or to make sb/sth more sympathetic and less severe or critical

name: solicitor
trans: n. 初级律师

sentences.english: You need to see a solicitor.
sentences.chinese: 你需要找个律师。

sentences.english: a small firm of solicitors
sentences.chinese: 一家小型律师事务所

detailed_translations.chinese: 律师；法务官；募捐者；掮客
detailed_translations.english: a type of lawyer in Britain who gives legal advice, prepares the necessary documents when property is bought or sold, and defends people, especially in the lower courts of law

name: soluble
trans: adj. 可溶的，可溶解的；可解决的 名 词: solubleness

sentences.english: soluble aspirin
sentences.chinese: 可溶性阿司匹林

detailed_translations.english: a soluble substance can be  dissolved  in a liquid

name: spacious
trans: adj. 宽敞的，广阔的；无边无际的 副 词: spaciously 名 词: spaciousness

sentences.english: a spacious living area
sentences.chinese: 宽敞的居住空间

detailed_translations.english: a spacious house, room etc is large and has plenty of space to move around in

name: spade
trans: n. 铁锹，铲子; vt. 铲；把……弄实抹平; vi. 铲 SPADEabbr. Spare Parts Analysis,Documentation andEvaluation...

sentences.english: ...a garden spade.
sentences.chinese: …一把花园里使用的锹。

detailed_translations.english: a tool for digging that has a long handle and a broad metal blade that you push into the ground

name: spirit
trans: n. 精神；心灵；志气；烈酒；情绪; vt. 鼓励；鼓舞；诱拐 时 态: spirited, spiriting, spirits

sentences.english: His spirits were so low (= he was so sad ) that he refused to answer his phone.
sentences.chinese: 他情绪非常低落，连电话也不愿接。

detailed_translations.chinese: 精神；心灵；情绪；志气；烈酒
detailed_translations.english: the qualities that make someone live the way they do, and make them different from other people

name: spit
trans: vt. & vi. 吐痰；吐出; 发出呼噜呼噜声; n. 口水，唾沫; 吐唾沫，吐痰 时 态: spat ，spit spitting，spits

sentences.english: Nick rolled down his window and spat.
sentences.chinese: 尼克摇下窗子，啐了口唾沫。

detailed_translations.chinese: 吐痰；吐口水；发出劈啪声
detailed_translations.english: to force a small amount of  saliva (= the liquid in your mouth )  out of your mouth
the watery liquid that is produced in your mouth

name: spy
trans: vt. 侦察；发现；暗中监视; vi. 侦察；当间谍; n. 间谍；密探

sentences.english: That day he spied on her while pretending to work on the shrubs.
sentences.chinese: 那天他假装修剪灌木，却秘密地监视着她。

detailed_translations.english: If you spy on someone, you watch them secretly
someone whose job is to find out secret information about another country, organization, or group
to suddenly see someone or something, especially after searching for them

name: standby
trans: n. 备用的人或物; 待命; 随时准备行动；处于待命状态; 等退票

name: startling
trans: adj. 令人震惊的,惊人的

sentences.english: Paddy’s words had a startling effect on the children.
sentences.chinese: 帕迪的话在孩子们身上产生了惊人的效果。

sentences.english: a startling discovery
sentences.chinese: 令人震惊的发现

detailed_translations.english: very unusual or surprising

name: stationary
trans: adj. 固定的；静止的；定居的；常备军的 n. 不动的人；驻军

sentences.english: How did you manage to drive into a stationary vehicle?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么开车的，竟会撞上一辆停着的车子？

detailed_translations.chinese: 固定的， 静止不动的
detailed_translations.english: standing still instead of moving

name: steering
trans: n. 掌舵；操纵；指导; v. 驾驶；掌舵

name: stir
trans: vt. & vi. 搅拌; 移动；激动; n. 搅动；搅和；搅拌; 激动；纷乱；骚乱 STIRabbr. Surveillance and Target Indication Rada...

sentences.english: Give that pan a stir , will you?
sentences.chinese: 把那锅东西搅一搅，好吗？

detailed_translations.english: an act of stirring something
to move a liquid or substance around with a spoon or stick in order to mix it together

name: stockpile
trans: n. 囤聚的物资; vt. 大量贮备 时 态: stockpiled, stockpiling, stockpiles

sentences.english: The two leaders also approved treaties to cut stockpiles of chemical weapons.
sentences.chinese: 两位领导人也都赞同削减化学武器储备的条约。

detailed_translations.english: a large supply of things that is kept ready for use in the future
to keep adding to a supply of goods, weapons etc that you are keeping ready to use if you need them in the future

name: strand
trans: n. 海滨；线；串; vt. 使搁浅；使陷于困境；弄断；使落后; vi. 搁浅 时 态: stranded, stranding, strands

sentences.english: She tried to blow a grey strand of hair from her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 她试图吹开眼前的一缕白发。

sentences.english: The climbers had been stranded by a storm.
sentences.chinese: 这些登山者被暴风雨困住了。

sentences.english: There is not a single pane of glass anywhere around the site, and the only mechanical ventilation installed is in the gallery.
sentences.chinese: 基地内的任何地方都没有单一的玻璃窗格，而且唯一的机械通风设备安装在了画廊中。

detailed_translations.chinese: 通风设备； 空气流通

name: vibration
trans: n. 震动; 一次性往复振动; 摆动；摇摆; 感受，共鸣；心灵感应 形容词: vibrational

sentences.english: the vibrations from the earthquake
sentences.chinese: 地震引起的震动

sentences.english: The microscope must be free from vibration.
sentences.chinese: 显微镜一定要避免震动。

detailed_translations.english: a continuous slight shaking movement

name: vice versa
trans: adv. 反过来也一样

sentences.english: The boys may refuse to play with the girls, and vice versa.
sentences.chinese: 男孩可能拒绝和女孩玩耍，反之亦然。

detailed_translations.english: used to say that the opposite of a situation you have just described is also true

name: vigorous
trans: adj. 有力的；精力充沛的 副 词: vigorously 名 词: vigorousness

sentences.english: Your dog needs at least 20 minutes of vigorous exercise every day.
sentences.chinese: 你的狗每天需要进行至少20分钟的剧烈运动。

sentences.english: Environmentalists have begun a vigorous campaign to oppose nuclear dumping in the area.
sentences.chinese: 环保人士已经发动了一场积极的运动，反对在该地区倾倒核废物。

sentences.english: a vigorous debate
sentences.chinese: 一场激烈的辩论

sentences.english: Vigorous efforts are being made to find a solution to the problem.
sentences.chinese: 正积极地寻找办法解决这个问题。

sentences.english: The measures provoked vigorous opposition in right-wing circles.
sentences.chinese: 这些举措激起了右翼群体的强烈反对。

detailed_translations.english: using a lot of energy and strength or determination

name: vocal
trans: adj. 口头的, 有声的, 发音的副 词: vocally

sentences.english: vocal music
sentences.chinese: 声乐

sentences.english: Allison’s vocal style is influenced by country and blues music.
sentences.chinese: 艾利森的演唱风格受到乡村音乐和布鲁斯音乐的影响。

sentences.english: a female vocal group
sentences.chinese: 女子歌唱组合

detailed_translations.chinese: 喜欢畅所欲言的，直言不讳的；嗓音的，发声的
detailed_translations.english: relating to the voice or to singing
the part of a piece of music that is sung rather than played on an instrument

name: vocational
trans: adj. 职业的, 为职业做准备的副 词: vocationally

sentences.english: vocational qualifications
sentences.chinese: 职业资格

detailed_translations.english: teaching or relating to the skills you need to do a particular job

name: volatile
trans: adj. 不稳定的；易变的；易怒的，喜怒无常的; 可能急剧波动的；不稳定的；易恶化的; 易挥发的，易气化的; 易失的; n. 挥发物; 有翅的动物 名 词: volatility

sentences.english: an increasingly volatile political situation
sentences.chinese: 日益动荡的政治局势

sentences.english: the highly volatile stock and bond markets
sentences.chinese: 相当不稳定的股票和债券市场

detailed_translations.chinese: [化学] 挥发性的；不稳定的；爆炸性的；反复无常的
detailed_translations.english: a volatile situation is likely to change suddenly and without warning

name: wag
trans: vt. & vi. 摇动, 摇摆时 态: wagged, wagging, wags

sentences.english: ‘You naughty girl!’ Mom said, wagging her finger at me.
sentences.chinese: “你这个调皮的丫头！”妈妈对我摇了摇手指说道。

detailed_translations.english: if a dog wags its tail, or if its tail wags, the dog moves its tail many times from one side to the other
someone who says or does something clever and amusing

name: warehouse
trans: n. 仓库, 货栈时 态: warehoused, warehousing, warehouses also

sentences.english: The building opposite us is the warehouse.
sentences.chinese: 我们对面的那个建筑是仓库。

sentences.english: Each warehouse reports back to the retailer which portion (if any) of the customer order it was able to fulfil.
sentences.chinese: 每个仓库把它能完成客户定单的哪个部分（如果有）的报告返回给零售商。

sentences.english: This option allows organizations to pay only for the volume of compressed user data they manage in their warehouse.
sentences.chinese: 该定价方式允许组织只为他们在其仓库中管理的压缩的用户数据量进行付费。

detailed_translations.english: a large building for storing large quantities of goods

name: waterfront
trans: n. 海〔湖〕滨;江边

sentences.english: The hotel is down on the waterfront.
sentences.chinese: 这家酒店位于滨水区。

detailed_translations.english: the part of a town or an area of land next to the sea, a river etc

name: waterproof
trans: adj. 不透水的，防水的; vt. 使防水；使不透水 时 态: waterproofed，waterproofing，waterproofs

sentences.english: a waterproof jacket
sentences.chinese: 防水上衣

sentences.english: waterproof adhesive
sentences.chinese: 防水黏合剂

sentences.english: Rub the wax in to make the shoe waterproof.
sentences.chinese: 在鞋子上抹点蜡使其防水。

detailed_translations.english: not allowing water to enter
a jacket or coat that does not allow rain and water through it

name: weird
trans: adj. 怪诞的；神秘而可怕的；超然的; 古怪的；离奇的 比较级: weirder，weirdest 副 词: weirdly 名 词: weirdness

sentences.english: A really weird thing happened last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚发生了一件非常奇怪的事。

sentences.english: He’s a weird bloke.
sentences.chinese: 他是个古怪的家伙。

sentences.english: They sell all sorts of weird and wonderful (= very strange ) products.
sentences.chinese: 他们出售各种稀奇古怪的产品。

detailed_translations.chinese: 古怪的， 离奇的； 怪诞的， 神秘而可怕的
detailed_translations.english: very strange and unusual, and difficult to understand or explain

name: wobble
trans: vi. 摇晃；摇摆；游移不定; n. 摆动；不稳定；摇晃; vt. 使摇摆；使颤动；摇动 时 态: wobbled, wobbling, wobbles 名 词: wob...

sentences.english: The pile of bricks wobbled and fell.
sentences.chinese: 那堆砖摇摇晃晃地倒塌了。

sentences.english: Tom stopped, wobbling from the weight of his load.
sentences.chinese: 汤姆停下来，身上的东西压得他摇摇晃晃。

sentences.english: We might look for a tiny wobble in the position of a star.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以期待在一颗恒星位置上的一个微小晃动。

detailed_translations.english: to move unsteadily from side to side, or make something do this
Wobble is also a noun

name: wrap
trans: vt. 包；隐藏；缠绕；掩护; vi. 缠绕；穿外衣；包起来; n. 外套；围巾 WRAPabbr. Web-Ready Appliances Protocol可上网家电协议时 态..

sentences.english: I’ve still got a few Christmas presents to wrap up.
sentences.chinese: 我还有一些圣诞礼物要包起来。

detailed_translations.english: to put paper or cloth over something to cover it
a piece of thick cloth that a woman wears around her shoulders
